results.title: Catalysis
results.brief_description: A study of catalysis as fourth factor in the velocity of chemical reactions. Explains how catalyst function by absorbing molecules, activating molecules forming an intermediate compound, or starting a chain reaction. Illustrates application of negative catalysts in the manufacture of rubber and anti-knock gasoline.

results.title: Catalysis
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description: Role of catalysis in lowering activation energy explained. Use on platinum gauze in production of nitric acid described, also role of Ti CL3 in polymerization of propene. Model of lysozyme with active site shown. Catalase activity in blood demonstrated. Animation by Stewart Hardy Films.
results.description: Role of catalysis in lowering activation energy explained. Use on platinum gauze in production of nitric acid described, also role of Ti CL3 in polymerization of propene. results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Val Lewton and Jacques Tourneur
results.brief_description: This classic horror tale stars Simone Simon as a young bride who is the victim of an ancient curse, that affects the female descendants of a Serbian village, transforming her into a panther to attack victims before reverting to human form. Also starring Kent Smith. Based on the story by DeWitt Bodeen.

results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, RKO Radio Pictures, Charles Fries and Paul Schrader
results.brief_description: A re-make of the 1942 horror classic starring Nastassia Kinski, Malcolm McDowell and John Heard. Irena is a beautiful young woman on the brink of exploring her sexuality. The experience brings tragic consequences and pushes her towards her bizarre destiny as her past and present collide. The orginal story held that an ancient race of women mated with big cats in the dawn of time. To become human again after mating, the “Cat people” must kill. Irena, who is in love with a human is condemned to repeat the patterns of her ancestors.

results.title: Cat on a hot tin roof
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Avon, Lawrence Weingarten and Richard Brooks
results.brief_description: A rich plantation owner, dying of cancer, finds his two sons unsatisfactory; one is a conniver, the other a neurotic who refuses to sleep with his wife. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Paul Newman, Burl Ives. Adapted from the Tennessee Williams’ play.

results.title: Cat journey
results.creator_credit: Svenska filminstitutet, Educational Media International and Lisbeth Gabrielsson
results.brief_description: Katie meets a friendly cat which takes her for a rather adventurous ride on its back. Their journey is full of many strange and sometimes scary encounters, but the cat is always there to save Katie. Adapted from the picture book by Ivar Arosenius. Suitable for children 4-7 years.

results.title: Cat Ballou
results.creator_credit: Harold Hecht Corporation, Harold Hecht and Elliot Silverstein
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin stars as both Tim Strawn (a noseless gunslinger) and Kid Shelleen, the woozy, boozy has-been who goes up against Strawn at high noon. Jane Fonda, at the height of her sex-kitten period, stars as Cat Ballou, the schoolmarm-turned outlaw who teams with Kid to protect her father’s ranch from a greedy railroad tycoon. One of the biggest box office hits of 1965, “Cat Ballou” was declared an instant classic with its sly blend of Western parody and rapid-fire action. Directed by Elliot Silverstein.

results.title: Cat and canary
results.brief_description: Cat and Canary were good friends. After their master left for the day, Cat would let Canary out of her cage, and they would have breakfast together and then go out onto the roof, where Cat would watch Canary flying about, wishing he could fly too. One day, Cat finds a kite snagged on the television antenna, and while trying to free it, becomes entangled in it himself. A gust of wind blows the kite high into the air, and Cat realises he is flying! Canary struggles to keep up, but the kite is going too fast. Suddenly, storm clouds appear in the sky, and Cat begins to feel afraid. As snow starts falling, Canary and a posse of birds come to Cat’s rescue, dragging the kite back to the roof of the house just as their master is returning home for the night. Despite the day’s drama, Cat is eager to take the kite up again tomorrow to journey to “the land beyond the river” with Canary and the birds. An iconographic film with limited animation, based on the children’s book by Michael Foreman.

results.title: Cat's cradle = Au bout du fil
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated fable without words starring some Gothic characters - witches, cloaked riders and the like - in a tale about the hungry natural world. Here the artist plays cat’s cradle with ideas, especially the notion that one thing leads to another and lives from another; he supports the action with a witch’s brew of sounds. Awards: Los Angeles; Zagreb

results.title: Cat's cradle
results.creator_credit: Luigi Acquisto, Chris McGill, Liz Hughes, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Film Victoria
results.brief_description:
The Father lies stiff and near-naked on the kitchen table. His family prepare his body for an outing to the cinema and then carry him through a bleak landscape of concrete roads and decaying factories. This short film combines highly expressionist black and white cinematography with an ominous atmospheric soundtrack. The result is a bizarre and perverse film that has the texture of a dream. Winner of multiple awards for Best Short Film, including prizes at the Melbourne, Edinburgh and London Film Festivals.
Cast includes Helen Rollinson, Ian Nash, Imogen Gough, Paul Bajada, Ryan Giddins and features William McInnes as an extra.
